derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from French angélique, via late Latin from Greek angelikos, from angelos (see angel)

entry.tran: 天使般的；善良的；温柔的
entry.def: You can describe someone as angelic if they are, or seem to be, very good, kind, and gentle.
Angelic means like angels or relating to angels.

means.word_mean: 1. marked by utter benignity; resembling or befitting an angel or saint;

sentences.sentence: "a saintly concern for his fellow men"

means.word_mean: 3. having a sweet nature befitting an angel or cherub;
